channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.title: Report X-2023100163
item.description:
Report X-2023100163

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-31T15:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-20
  • City: BINGHAMTON
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: It was found with wet spots on the side of the box. It was put on a tugger and brought over to the hazmat cage and put on the fumes hud. DescribePack: The caps on all four jugs were loose, but two of them only spilled. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was put on the fumes hud with the fan on.

item.title: Report X-2023100126
item.description:
Report X-2023100126

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-20
  • City: BUFFALO
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023100126 SequenceEvent: After preload sort on 09/20/2023, a Hazmat package on delivery vehicle was discovered to be damaged and leaking contents into truck. QA quickly contained leak by removing damaged package from vehicle and placing it in a red plastic Fedex Ground Hazmat bin with plastic liner and taking to QA cage on site DescribePack: Two plastic jugs of Hydrochloric acid damaged and leaking contents from loose/damaged caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Damaged package placed in red plastic Fedex Ground Hazmat bin with plastic liner and staged in Hazmat cage on site for future processing by QA. Leaking Hydrochloric Acid inside delivery vehicle with absorbent. 2. X-2023100817 SequenceEvent: Package was discovered around 1030 am by a driver who alerted QA and hazmat trained personnel who immediately cleared the area and initiated clean up using a hazmat bin for transport of the package and material and neutralizer for cleanup and got the hazmat package to the hazmat cage in the appropriate bin. DescribePack: Package had poor handling insufficient packaging materials and inner packaging and dents to the inner containers. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The area was evacuated the material was contained and cleaned up rather quickly.

item.title: Report X-2023091102
item.description:
Report X-2023091102

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-13
  • City: RENSSELAER
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the preload sort a package handler was unloading when he noticed the package was wet, he contacted his manager who contacted the hazmat team. The package was then placed into a hazmat bag and then a yellow hazmat drum to be placed into the hazmat cage under ventilation. which noticed that the cap was loose on one of the containers and the safety seal was punctured as well. The package DescribePack: The cap on one of the containers was loose as well as the safety seal on the same one. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was contained and placed into a hazmat bag and placed into a hazmat bag then into a yellow hazmat drum, sealed and placed into the hazmat cage under ventilation.

Report X-2023091075

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package found on end of the ic belt on its side and wet. upon discovery package was placed in hazmat tote lined with bag and taken to hazmat cage for further inspection. DescribePack: upon inspection it appears to have a bad seal and loose ca causing leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package place in hazmat tote lined with bag and taken to hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023091066
item.description:
Report X-2023091066

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-07
  • City: SYRACUSE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to door 219 for a potent smell coming from the trailer. QA brought a tote with a bag inside it while wearing gloves and mask and inspected the boxes inside the trailer. QA found the box and opened it to find it was a hazmat that leaked. Once confirmed it was a hazmat QA quickly got a hazmat bag and tote and put it in there and brought it back to QA area after cleaning the spill. DescribePack: the bottom of the body had a crack causing it to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: qa put it inside a hazmat tote and bag and brought it back to qa area.

item.title: Report E-2023100642
item.description:
Report E-2023100642

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-26T15:12:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-26
  • City: NEWBURGH
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Material handler observed a drum that was staged slightly overhanging on a pallet leaking from the bottom of the drum where it was overhanging. No action was discovered that caused this damage and unintentional leak but it was assumed that it had been hit by other freight. The spilled material was neutralized and cleaned with absorbents and placed into a recovery container as was the damaged drum.

item.title: Report X-2023100105
item.description:
Report X-2023100105

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-22
  • City: BROOKLYN
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THIS PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED ON TRUCK#618 WET,WHEN I INSPECT THIS PACKAGE THE GLASS BOTTLE IS BROKEN DUE TO POSSIBLE MISHANDLING OF PACKAGE WHILE IN TRANSIT. DescribePack: WHEN I INSPECT THE DAMAGE GLASS IS BROKEN,DUE TO THE DRIVER MISHANDLING THE PACKAGE IN TRANSIT. DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: WHILE IN TRANSIT THE DRIVER NEEDS TO BE MORE CAREFUL WITH THE HAZMAT TO MINIMIZING THE IMPACT OF DAMAGES.

item.title: Report X-2023091059
item.description:
Report X-2023091059

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-22
  • City: WEST HENRIETTA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: 432-Colo sent us a trailer with a damaged hazmat inside. We had QA members bring it to the hazmat cage safely and begin processing the damaged hazmat. DescribePack: Loose caps caused the liquid to spill inside the box and leak outside of the packaging onto another box. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately placed into the hazmat cage.
